Brief Hospital Course:
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: 
=================== 
___ PMH DDRT ___ on Tacro / prednisone with recent baseline Cr
___, HTN, HLD, CAD, h/o DVT, pAfib not on AC, depression,
recurrent MDR UTI, osteonecrosis of L hip s/p girdlestone
procedure (currently wheelchair bound) presenting from SNF with
abdominal pain and dysuria, found to have UTI and bilateral DVT.

ACUTE ISSUES:
# UTI
UA consistent with UTI, urine culture growing pan-sensitive E
coli. Has hx MDR UTIs, E coli susceptible to ceftazidime and
meropenem. No current dysuria or urinary symptoms, transitioned
from ceftazidine to fosfomycin. Completed fosfomycin q48H x3 
doses prior to discharge with resolution of symptoms.

# DVT
Noted to have bilateral ___ edema on admission. LENIs revealed
partially occlusive thrombus of L superficial femoral vein
extending into popliteal vein, and partially occlusive subacute
to chronic thrombus within R superficial femoral vein. Had been
off AC on admission due to history of hemorrhagic stroke; 
resumed
apixaban based on DVT. Loaded with apixaban 10MG BID for 1 week, 
ongoing at time of discharge, should be transitioned to apixaban 
5MG BID on ___.

# Adrenal Insufficiency
# Hypoglycemia
# Hyperkalemia
Patient on chronic steroids for renal transplant. This admission
had hypoglycemia, hyponatremia, hyperkalemia concerning for 
adrenal insufficiency in setting of physiologic stress, i.e. 
infection (UTI). AM Cortisol low at 1.8. Cortisol 1.3->6.2 with 
cosyntropin test suggestive of adrenal insufficiency. 
Hyperkalemia was transient and resolved with dietary changes. 
Evaluated by endocrinology with diagnosis of primary adrenal 
insufficiency in the setting of adrenal atrophy from chronic 
prednisone use. No concern for other causes of primary adrenal 
insufficiency given intact mineralocorticoid activity based on 
labs with only transient hyperK. Per endocrinology "patient to 
take double steroid dose for two days if she feel sick or has a 
cold. Furthermore told to triple dose for three days if very 
ill. Will require stress dose
steroids under periods of increased stress (eg infection,
surgery)" Per endocrine, "pt to receive Solu-cortef 100mg 1 vial 
IM
prescription (ACT-O-VIAL)at discharge with rx for BD ___
Syringe 3ml 23 gauge. Pt instructed to use in emergency to
prevent adrenal crisis."

# Access
# PICC Site Bleeding
Access difficult to obtain, patient refused attempted lab draws. 
PICC placed for access and hydration on ___. Removed PICC on 
___ due to persistent bleeding from site. Given INR 1.8 (higher 
than would anticipate on apixaban) in setting of malnutrition 
and prolonged poor PO intake, possible nutritional component of 
coagulopathy contributing to bleeding, dosed PO vitamin K. INR 
1.8->1.7 with vitamin K, re-dosed on ___. Bleeding stabilized 
prior to discharge, hemoglobin remaining stable. Note mild 
hypofibrinogenemia (180s, then 205 on discharge, without any 
FFP/cryo). 

# Malnutrition
# Hypoalbuminemia
# Poor PO intake
Albumin 2.5 on arrival with mild proteinuria. ___ swelling likely
due primarily to DVT, but may also be some element of
hypoalbuminemia contributing. Poor PO intake due to patient's
dietary restrictions and preferences. Continued nutritional 
supplementation as per inpatient nutrition recs.

# ___
# ESRD s/p DDRT in ___.
Baseline Cr 1.0 - 1.5 in ___. She had severe scarring on
biopsy in ___. Cr 1.7 on presentation, improved to 1.0 with 
fluids.
Transplant US unremarkable. Likely mild pre-renal given
improvement with IV fluids. Tacro Trough goal ___. Continued 
Tacrolimus 0.5mg BID, checked daily levels while inpatient. 
Continued prednisone 5mg daily, acyclovir 400mg BID. Followed by 
transplant nephrology while admitted, will continue outpatient 
follow-up.

CHRONIC ISSUES:
===============
#Abdominal pain
#GERD
#H/o duodenal polyps
Chronic epigastric pain most likely due to GERD vs. gastritis, 
possibly with functional component. Discussed with patient's GI 
(Dr ___. LFTs WNL. Continued omeprazole, sucralfate, Zofran. 
Dicyclomine empirically uptitrated to 20 QID.

#AFib with RVR 
Home metoprolol fractionated to tartrate on admission in setting 
of infection. Subsequently resumed home metoprolol succinate on 
discharge. Anticoagulated with apixaban as above.

#Hypothyroidism
Continued home levothyroxine 88mcg daily.

#CAD
Continued home ASA, rosuvastatin. Metoprolol fractionated to 
tartrate as above, resumed home succinate on discharge.

#Anxiety/depression
Continued home duloxetine.

#Back pain
Continued home oxycodone 5mg Q12H:PRN.

#Constipation
Continued home Bisacodyl, held home milk of magnesia. Also 
received senna, miralax for constipation.

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
=====================

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,  
 
It was a pleasure taking part in your care here at ___!  

Why was I admitted to the hospital?  
- You were evaluated for pain with urination and abdominal pain, 
and found to have a urinary tract infection.
 
What was done for me while I was in the hospital?  
- You were treated with antibiotics for your urinary infection 
and improved
- You had an ultrasound that revealed blood clots (DVT) in your 
legs. You were started on a blood thinner (apixaban) to treat 
your blood clots
- You had increased abdominal pain, and one of your home pain 
medications (dicyclomine) was increased
- You were evaluated by our kidney transplant team, and your 
home immunosuppression was continued
- You were evaluated by our nutrition team and continued on 
supplements to augment your nutritional intake

What should I do when I leave the hospital?  
- Continue to take all of your medications as prescribed 
- Attend all of your scheduled follow-ups

Sincerely,  
Your ___ Care Team

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
